content:
(a) Magnetic field lines show the direction (at every point) along which a small magnetised needle aligns (at the point). Do the magnetic field lines also represent the lines of force on a moving charged particle at every point?

(b) If magnetic monopoles existed, how would the Gauss's law of magnetism be modified?
summary: This text discusses whether magnetic field lines represent the direction of a small magnetized needle (at every point) and what changes to Gauss's law of magnetism would occur if magnetic monopoles existed.
hypothetical_questions: Does the magnetic field lines show the direction of a small magnetized needle?
Are the magnetic field lines along which a moving charged particle aligns?
How would the Gauss's law of magnetism be modified if magnetic monopoles existed?
